# Creating and Managing a Team in Appdome

Last updated January 25, 2026 by Appdome

Working as a team in Appdome lets you assign specific roles and responsibilities to different members—one can build the app, another can sign it, and a third can review or test it. By creating a team in Appdome, you can control access, manage entitlements, and maintain full visibility into team activities and app progress from a central dashboard.

To use Appdome for Teams, you’ll need an Appdome Ideal-GO or Higher [account](https://fusion.appdome.com/signup).

## Create a Team

#### Step by Step:

1. Log in to your Appdome account.
2. Hover over the left sidebar to extend it. Then, select **Workspace**, and **Personal Workspace**.  
   [![Appdome Left Menu](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Appdome_Left_Menu.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Appdome_Left_Menu.png)
3. Click + **Create New Team**.  
   [![Appdome Create New Team Button](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Appdome_Create_New_Team_Button.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Appdome_Create_New_Team_Button.png)
4. Fill in the requested details.
   * You can [upload a CSV file](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/cyber-release-management/add-team-members-with-entitlements-and-roles-from-csv-in-devsecops-build-system/) containing the names of team members and their entitlements, and roles.

![Team Workspace](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Screenshot-2024-05-02-at-10.42.36.png)

## Editing and Managing Teams

After creating a team, you can modify, edit, and manage it on Appdome, including:

* **View Team Details**
  + Edit the team name and description.
  + View Team Type, Team ID, and Fusion Set Naming Policy.
  + Request to delete a team.
* **View Team Members**
  + View a team member’s name, role, and last activity
  + Remove a specific team member
  + Edit and add a member’s [entitlements](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/app-sec-release-teams/set-user-entitlements-mobile-app-security-projects/).
* **Invite New Member**
* **Duplicate Team**
  + Invite all existing members of your current team to your new team.
  + Add fusion sets from your existing team to your new team.
* **Navigate to the Team Workspace**

#### Step by Step:

1. Log in to your Appdome account.
2. Hover over the left sidebar to extend it. Then, select **Team Management from the left side menu**.
3. Select a team from the list and click … next to the relevant team’s name, then select the relevant option from the dropdown menu. ![Team Management](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Team-Management.png)
4. **Set a team as Favorite Workspace:** If you have multiple teams, you can click the **star** icon to add a specific team to your favorites and pin it to the top of the list.  
   Every time you log into Appdome’s UI – The Team’s workspace will automatically open.
5. **Pin to Top:** For easier access to your most used Team workspaces, you can select Pin to Top from the menu. You can pin up to 3 workspaces.  
   [![Appdome Left Team Menu](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Appdome_Left_Team_Menu.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Appdome_Left_Team_Menu.png)

## Next steps

After you have created your team, follow these steps to complete your mobile integration project.

### 1. Upload a Mobile App to Your Team

Once the team is created, you can add apps to it. Click **Add App** at the top left of the screen.  
![Add App](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Add-App.png)

### 2. Build the App

After you have added a mobile app to your team account, you can start [choosing and enabling](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/#) various Appdome security features to be added to your app.

### 3. Add Context™ to the Appdome-Fused App (Optional)

You can [brand](https://appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/cyber-release-management/update-app-icon-branding-in-secure-android-ios-apps/) the app, including adding a favicon to denote the new service added to the app.

### 4. Sign the Appdome Fused App

In order to deploy an Appdome Fused app, it must be signed. [Signing an iOS app](https://appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/signing-secured-apps/sign-secured-ios-apps-without-xcode ) and[Signing an Android app](https://appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/signing-secured-apps/sign-secured-android-apps-without-android-studio/) is easy using Appdome. Alternatively, you can use [Private Signing](https://appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/signing-secured-apps/securely-automate-ios-app-signing-cicd/), download your unsigned app, and sign locally using your own signing methods.

### 5. Deploy the Appdome-Fused App to a Mobile Device

Once you have signed your Appdome-Fused app, you can [download and deploy](https://appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/app-sec-release-automation/auto-publish-secured-android-ios-apps/) it using your distribution method of choice.

Congratulations! – Enjoy collaborating with Appdome for Teams!
